column3: ## Upload a file containing ISSNs erroneously shared with another account
Setup: Ensure that the ISSN "1111-1111" is attached a journal owned by the publisher and ISSN "2222-2222" is attached to the same journal and also to another journal not owned by the publisher
Setup: You must be logged in using a pure publisher account (no other privileges)

Go to the "Upload Article XML" tab in the "Publisher Area"

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//publisher/uploadfile

Browse for a file under "Select a file" and select the test resource file "shared_issn.xml" from the Crossref 5.3.1 resources

Test Resource: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DOAJ/doaj/hotfix/20230831_exception_invalid_pdd/doajtest/xml_upload_test_package/Crossref/5.3.1/shared_issn.xml
Choose "Crossref 5.3.1 XML" from "Format of the file" dropdown

column4: A flash message appears at the top of the screen indicating a successful upload
Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "pending"

column3: wait a short amount of time for the job to process, then reload the page (do not re-submit the form data). If the job remains in "pending", reload the page until the status changes.

column4: Your file is shown in the "History of uploads" with status "processing failed" and a suitable entry in the "Notes".  Check that the explanation link goes to a suitable reason and resolution for the problem.

column3: click on "(show error details)" for the record in the "History of uploads"

column4: Additional error details are shown, indicating that the ISSN "2222-2222" is shared with another user
